thread.title: Cavaliers anything but as islanders ousted from postseason
thread.title_full: Cavaliers anything but as islanders ousted from postseason

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Cavaliers anything but as islanders ousted from postseason
text:
Cavaliers anything but as islanders ousted from postseason Visitors cross Penobscot Bay to double up islanders By Staff | Oct 23, 2015 
Vinalhaven — The Vinalhaven/North Haven boys soccer team was happy to be in a position to host a prelim playoff game on Friday afternoon, Oct. 23 as the No. 7 islanders hosted No. 10 Valley of Bingham in a Class D South pitch clash. 
However, the islanders were not quite as happy with the result. 
The hosts had no answer for Cavalier striker Cody Lawyerson, who netted a hat trick in a 4-2 win for Valley. 
Ethan Anthony and Henry Noyes scored goals for Vinalhaven/North Haven (5-8), while Joe Thomas added a tally for Valley (6-8-1) in addition to Lawyerson’s hat trick. 
“We did not play a good game,” said islander coach Richard Carlsen. “I told the boys to mark up the Lawyerson kid and they didn't mark him up. They left him open almost every time up the field.” 
Isles Blackington made nine saves on 14 shots for the islanders, while Valley’s keeper, whose name was unavailable, countered with nine saves on 17 shots. 
The Cavaliers held a 7-3 edge in corner kicks and 3-1 lead at halftime. 
With the win, Valley advances to the quarterfinals, where it will face No. 2 Richmond (9-4). The Bobcats earned a 7-0 win over the Cavaliers on Sept. 19 in Richmond and a 4-1 victory Oct. 15 in Bingham. 
While disappointed with the loss, Carlsen put the team’s season in perspective. 
“I will say that living in a small community our kids work very hard [lobstering] in the offseason and rarely put the effort in playing any sport when that sport [season] is over,” he said. “These larger schools have the opportunity to play most of the year in leagues and pickup games. 
“I am very proud of my boys to make it to the seventh [seed] when they only picked up the ball at the end of August.”
